column4: Can someone help me with disabling onboard video?  Please take a look at this output: http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/d20c30f8c
I can do that, but shouldnt blacklisting the modules prevent it from working?
I have a garbage dell that only lets me choose onboard or auto in the bios
and I had to blacklist it before to get the nvidia to work
disable it in bios
the problem is, when I boot with the nvidia adapter, it wont boot
I cant even get into recovery mode
and Im pretty sure its trying to use the onboard adapter in ubuntu
yeah
I always had to blacklist i915/agpgart before
and I'm just trying to verify that the onboard IS disabled by booting with it for now
and it never gets disabled
unless somehow the kernel is forcing it to use the i915 modules regardless of what I do with modprobe.d/blacklist.conf
which is seeming that way
is it possible to disable kernel modules from loading?  or is that what blacklist.conf does
thats what blacklist does
so why does it still say it's being used after I blacklisted it?
!blacklist | Undertow
http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/d20c30f8c
check that out please
did you look at that output?
dont have a x-server here
